articles.author: Bo Erickson, Richard Cowan, Katharine Jackson, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson was reelected to the chamber's top job on Friday by a razor-thin margin that highlighted potential fissures among President-elect Donald Trump's Republicans on Capitol Hill.
articles.title: Trump's Republicans reelect Mike Johnson US House Speaker despite dissent

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel carried out air strikes on dozens of Hamas targets in Gaza over the past 24 hours, it said on Friday, in attacks that Palestinian health authorities said had killed nearly 100 people.
articles.title: Israeli air strikes ramp up Gaza death toll amid new truce push

articles.author: Eduardo Baptista, Hyunsu Yim, Joyce Lee
articles.description: Authorities were en route on Friday to execute an arrest warrant for impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, Yonhap News Agency reported, as a crowd of protesters faced off with police outside his residence and vowed to block any attempt.
articles.title: South Korea authorities moving to arrest impeached President Yoon, Yonhap says

articles.author: Erin Banco, Jonathan Landay, Idrees Ali
articles.description: A U.S. Army veteran who flew a black Islamic State flag on a truck that he rammed into New Year's revelers in New Orleans shows how the extremist group still retains the ability to inspire violence despite suffering years of losses to a U.S.-led military coalition.
articles.title: New Orleans attack puts spotlight on Islamic State comeback bid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Biden administration has informally notified the U.S. Congress of a proposed $8 billion arms sale to Israel that includes munitions for fighter jets and attack helicopters, Axios reported on Friday, citing two sources.
articles.title: US plans $8 billion arms sale to Israel, Axios reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The foreign ministers of Germany and France said they wanted to forge a new relationship with Syria and urged a peaceful transition as they visited Damascus meet its de facto new leader Ahmed al-Sharaa on behalf of the European Union.
articles.title: German, French foreign ministers in Damascus to meet Syria's new rulers

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Israel on Friday defended its raid on a north Gaza hospital last week while the U.N. human rights chief called the justification unsubstantiated and the World Health Organization urged Israel to release the hospital's director from detention.
articles.title: At UN, Israel defends Gaza hospital raid, UN rights chief says its explanation is vague

articles.author: Ned Randolph
articles.description: Music is again streaming from clubs and restaurants are filled with tourists.
articles.title: Resilient New Orleans regains its stride, hardly missing a beat after truck attack

articles.author: Marek Strzelecki, Lili Bayer
articles.description: Poland launched its presidency of the Council of the European Union on Friday mired in a diplomatic row with Hungary that underscored a deepening sense of political disunity across Europe just as it confronts a raft of major global challenges.
articles.title: Spats, divisions mar start of Poland's EU presidency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Myanmar's military government will release 5,864 prisoners, including 180 foreigners, under an amnesty marking the Southeast Asian nation's independence day, state media said on Saturday.
articles.title: Myanmar junta to free 5,864 prisoners under amnesty
